question.title: JAR File not running with standard JDK
question.body:
So I have a JAR file of my JavaFX application and everytime I run it I get this error:

Graphics Device initialization failed for :  d3d, sw
Error initializing QuantumRenderer: no suitable pipeline found
java.lang.RuntimeException: java.lang.RuntimeException: Error initializing QuantumRenderer: no suitable pipeline found
        at com.sun.javafx.tk.quantum.QuantumRenderer.getInstance(QuantumRenderer.java:283)
        at com.sun.javafx.tk.quantum.QuantumToolkit.init(QuantumToolkit.java:253)
        at com.sun.javafx.tk.Toolkit.getToolkit(Toolkit.java:263)
        at com.sun.javafx.application.PlatformImpl.startup(PlatformImpl.java:290)
        at com.sun.javafx.application.PlatformImpl.startup(PlatformImpl.java:162)
        at com.sun.javafx.application.LauncherImpl.startToolkit(LauncherImpl.java:651)
        at com.sun.javafx.application.LauncherImpl.launchApplication1(LauncherImpl.java:671)
        at com.sun.javafx.application.LauncherImpl.lambda$launchApplication$2(LauncherImpl.java:196)
        at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:1589)
Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: Error initializing QuantumRenderer: no suitable pipeline found
        at com.sun.javafx.tk.quantum.QuantumRenderer$PipelineRunnable.init(QuantumRenderer.java:95)
        at com.sun.javafx.tk.quantum.QuantumRenderer$PipelineRunnable.run(QuantumRenderer.java:125)
        ... 1 more
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.RuntimeException: No toolkit found
        at com.sun.javafx.tk.Toolkit.getToolkit(Toolkit.java:275)
        at com.sun.javafx.application.PlatformImpl.startup(PlatformImpl.java:290)
        at com.sun.javafx.application.PlatformImpl.startup(PlatformImpl.java:162)
        at com.sun.javafx.application.LauncherImpl.startToolkit(LauncherImpl.java:651)
        at com.sun.javafx.application.LauncherImpl.launchApplication1(LauncherImpl.java:671)
        at com.sun.javafx.application.LauncherImpl.lambda$launchApplication$2(LauncherImpl.java:196)
        at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:1589)

After a lot of searching, I found that the only way to run my JavaFX JAR without errors was to uninstall JDK 24 from Oracle and instead install the "Liberica Full JDK 21.0.6+10 x86 32 for Windows" from https://bell-sw.com/pages/downloads/#jdk-24. This version works flawlessly and I get no more QuantumRenderer or pipeline errors. I’ve tested multiple versions from both Oracle and BellSoft, and the full Liberica JDK is the only one that consistently works. However, I’d really prefer to use the standard Oracle JDK if possible. Does anyone know why this happens or how to fix it while keeping the Oracle JDK?

question_comments.body: Show full command line for these type  of errors.

Presumably Liberica 21 works for you because you are using a "Liberica JDK Full with JavaFX," release. If you want to run a JavaFX app using a Oracle JDK (since Java 8!) (or indeed any JDK that doesn't include JavaFX!) you need to download a compatible JavaFX implementation and include it in your application's runtime classpath. The duplink chain should explain how. JavaFX was unbundled from Oracle Java starting with Java 9.
